content: I cannot speculate about intentions, but it is generally believed that the art of the late middle ages, particularly in europe, was created with a strong religious purpose. the artists of the time were often commissioned by the church and other religious institutions to create art that would serve as a visual expression of christian doctrine and morality. this art was intended to inspire piety and devotion among the faithful, and to reinforce the power of the church by depicting its saints, leaders and holy stories. however, it is also true that the dominant cultural and social beliefs of the time were heavily influenced by religion, so it's possible that the art was a reflection of this broader context as well.
